array.string:
Antibiotics
  • Rapid administration of appropriate antibiotics

Antibiotics
  • Administer appropriate antibiotics within 6 hours.
    Source Control
  • Early imaging to confirm source if appropriate
  • Early surgical/interventional evaluation if appropriate
  • Early drainage of purulent collection or removal of infected device if relevant
Is the patient experiencing bleeding or ischemia?
( Vancomycin / ceftriaxone ) *Consider treatment for viral *Consider ampicillin for Listeria
( Vancomycin / cefepime ) *Consider treatment for viral *Consider ampicillin for Listeria
( Vancomycin / cefepime / acyclovir / ampicillin ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb
( Vancomycin / macrolide / 3rd gen cephalosporin ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone ) *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / Aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN / macrolide ) *Consider treatment for PCP, fungals, Tb *Consider treatment for influenza
( Vancomycin / amino-PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole) *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole ) *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / metronidazole / aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb *Consider broader C.Diff coverage with PO vancomycin
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin ) *Consider anti-pseudomonal PCN if diabetic or vascular disease *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) *Consider clindamycin for suspected toxic shock syndrome
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN )
( Vanco / carbapenem / fluoroquinolone )
( 3rd generation cephalosporin ) OR ( fluoroquinolone )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone )
( Vancomycin / anti-pseudomonal PCN ) OR ( Vancomycin / fluoroquinolone / Aminoglycoside ) *Consider treatment for fungals, Tb
Is there a removable source?
Respiratory Support
Consider emergent rapid sequence intubation for shock.
Resuscitate with Isotonic crystalloid or colloid and transfuse with blood to obtain euvolemia, adequate urine output

• Resuscitate as needed, consider vasopressor to get MAP>60
  • Avoid fluid overload targeting CVP and urine output as per Fluid Management Goals in MORE
  • Avoid RBC transfusion unless Hgb < 7g/dL
Fluids
Is the patient in shock?
Stop/Maintain Euvolumia (CVP 8-10)
